text: Lampius (; ) (died 400 AD) was bishop of Barcelona from 393 to 400 AD. He is best remembered for being responsible for the ordination of Saint Paulinus of Nola on Christmas, 393 AD, in the cathedral of Barcelona.Otto Bardenhewer, Patrology: The Lives and Works of the Fathers of the Church. Translated by Thomas J. Shahan (Kessinger Publishing, 2006), 447. He also attended the First Council of Toledo.Documento sin título ==Notes== ==External links== *Episcopologi (In Catalan) Category:Bishops of Barcelona Category:4th-century bishops Category:400 deaths Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Lampius
